content.title:
Immigrant Eligibility for 
 Public Benefits in New York State
content.source: Empire Justice Center and The New York Immigration Coalition
content.description:
A chart that lists federal benefits and New York State benefits based on immigration status. 

It also identifies what benefits could potentially have public charge implications.

content.title: Immigrant Eligibility for Federal Programs
content.description: A chart that lists available federal benefits and public assistance programs based on immigration status.

content.title: Public Benefits Maps
content.description: Interactive maps that list available public benefits based on immigrant’s state and immigration status.

content.title: Public Benefits Charts
content.description: Charts that list available federal and state benefits based on an immigrant's state and immigration status.

content.title: Resources for Undocumented Immigrants During COVID-19
content.description: A list of compiled resources for undocumented immigrants to help navigate the COVID-19 pandemic.

content.title: Free Medical Clinic Directory
content.description: A directory of free clinics that serve individuals without healthcare insurance, based on state.

content.title:
Healthcare Access for Undocumented Immigrants 
During COVID-19
content.description:
A list of free/ low-cost/ community health care centers and other resources accessible to individuals without healthcare insurance, based on state. 

Although undocumented individuals are typically not eligible for health insurance, there are many free/ low-cost clinics that are accessible to individuals without healthcare insurance.

content.title: ICE Will Not Make Arrests at Hospitals
content.source: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (U.S. ICE)
content.description: "ICE does not conduct enforcement operations at medical facilities, except under extraordinary circumstances. Claims to the contrary are false and create unnecessary fear within communities. Individuals should continue to seek medical care."

content.title: USCIS COVID-19 Public Charge Notice
content.description: USCIS will not consider COVID-19 testing, treatment, or preventive care (including vaccines) as part of a public charge inadmissibility determination, even if paid for by a public benefit like Medicaid.

content.title: Public Charge Rule and COVID-19 FAQs
content.source: Government of the District of Columbia
content.description: A compiled list of frequently asked questions and answers about the new Aug 14, 2019 final public charge rule and COVID-19.

content.title: Understanding the Impact of the COVID-19 Relief Bills on Immigrant Communities
content.description: A policy brief that provides information on the impact of the COVID-19 relief package on low-income immigrants and more.

content.title: COVID-19 Stimulus Package: What CARES Act Rebates Mean for Immigrants
content.description: A report about the implications and consequences of the CARES Act rebates for immigrants.

content.title: Recovery Rebates and Unemployment Compensation under the CARES Act: Immigration-Related Eligibility Criteria
content.description: The Congressional Research Service report about immigration-related eligibility requirements for the two types of benefits established by the CARES Act: (1) the tax credits/rebates; and (2) the various forms of federally funded unemployment insurance benefits.

content.title: How Uninsured Patients Can Get Help During the Covid-19 Pandemic
content.description: This article explains how states are expanding eligibility so they can temporarily insure more of their residents during the pandemic. Private insurance companies are also asking Congress to open up enrollment on the federal exchange.

content.title: Resources for Domestic Workers during COVID-19
content.description: A COVID-19 related resources for domestic workers (ex: working safely, getting support, vaccines).

content.title: Fair Practices for Employers
content.source: Hand in Hand: The Domestic Employers Network

content.title: Resources for Domestic Workers
content.description: The National Domestic Workers Alliance is providing emergency assistance for domestic workers that enables them to stay home and healthy.
